caption: Packet
description: The Packet object represents a single captured network packet and its associated metadata. It describes where the packet came from, how it is stored or encoded, and how it can be located within a capture file or stream. This object does not interpret protocol content; it only represents the captured packet data and its positioning information.
name: packet

encoding.description: The human-readable name of the encoding used to represent the packet data in the value field. This should match the caption associated with encoding_id. If encoding_id is 99 (Other), this field contains the original data source–specific encoding value.

encoding_id.description: The normalized identifier of the encoding method used to represent the packet data as a string.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The encoding format of the packet data is not known.

1.caption: Base64
1.description: The packet data is encoded using Base64.

2.caption: Hexadecimal
2.description: The packet data is encoded as a hexadecimal string representation of the raw bytes.

3.caption: URL Encoded
3.description: The packet data is encoded using percent-encoding (URL encoding).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The encoding method is not mapped. Refer to the encoding field for the original source-specific value.

end_offset.description: The ending byte position of this packet within a capture file or stream.

format.description: The human-readable name of the packet capture file format in which the packet is stored. This should match the caption associated with format_id. If format_id is 99 (Other), this field contains the original data source–specific format value.

format_id.description: The normalized identifier of the packet capture format.

1.caption: PCAP
1.description: Standard libpcap/tcpdump packet capture file format.

2.caption: PCAPNG
2.description: Next-generation PCAP format that supports multiple interfaces and enhanced metadata.

4.caption: ERF
4.description: Extensible Record Format used by Endace network monitoring hardware.

5.caption: NetMon
5.description: Microsoft Network Monitor capture file format.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The packet format is not mapped. Refer to the format field for the original source-specific value.

sequence_number.description: The relative order number of this packet within a capture session, file, or reconstructed stream. This value represents capture order and is not the same as a protocol-level sequence number (such as a TCP sequence number).

source.description: The human-readable name describing how or where the packet was obtained. This should match the caption associated with source_id. If source_id is 99 (Other), this field contains the original data source–specific value.

source_id.description: A normalized numeric identifier that specifies how the packet was obtained or generated.

1.caption: Wire
1.description: The packet was captured directly from a network interface.

2.caption: Stream
2.description: The packet was reconstructed or derived from a stream of packets.

3.caption: Decoder
3.description: The packet was generated or extracted by a protocol decoder or analysis engine.

4.caption: TAP
4.description: The packet was captured from a physical network Test Access Point (TAP) device used for passive monitoring.

5.caption: SPAN
5.description: The packet was captured from a switch Switched Port Analyzer (SPAN) or mirror port.

6.caption: Endpoint
6.description: The packet was captured by a host-based agent or endpoint detection and response (EDR) sensor.

7.caption: Virtual
7.description: The packet was captured from a virtual network interface, virtual switch, or container network.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The packet source is not mapped. Refer to the source field for the original source-specific value.

start_offset.description: The starting byte position of this packet within a capture file or stream.

value.description: The actual packet data, represented as a string. The format of this string is determined by the specified encoding_id (e.g., Base64, Hexadecimal, or URL Encoded).
